title: Add right-click context menu in graph
description: Right-click node for quick actions: edit, delete, add dependency, mark complete, etc.

title: Improve error handling with plain English messages
description: Current errors show raw API responses. Replace with friendly messages: 'AI is temporarily unavailable - try again in a moment', 'Could not connect to the internet', 'Something went wrong - your data is safe'. Add retry buttons where appropriate. Never show technical stack traces to users.

title: Rename product from Beads to Middle Manager in UI and docs
description: Update all references: AGENTS.md product vision, page titles, header logo/text, any marketing copy. 'Beads' refers to the underlying issue tracking system, 'Middle Manager' is the product name for the AI-powered planning tool.

title: Add drag-to-connect for creating dependencies in graph
description: Drag from one node to another to create a dependency. Show preview line while dragging.

title: Hover details popup in graph
description: Hover over node shows full details: description, dependencies, blockers, status. No click needed.

title: Create issues directly in graph view
description: Click empty space in graph to create new issue. AI suggests title based on context/nearby nodes.

title: Add contextual 'What next?' guidance throughout app
description: Guide users at key moments: After first task created: 'Great\! Now add tasks this depends on'. After 3+ tasks: 'Let AI organize your dependencies'. When graph is messy: 'Your plan is getting complex - try List view'. When task is blocked: 'This is waiting on [X] - want to work on that first?'. Subtle, dismissable hints that teach the mental model.

title: Replace technical jargon with plain language throughout
description: Rename terminology to be intuitive for non-experts: 'Blocked' → 'Waiting for', 'Ready' → 'Can start now', 'Dependencies' → 'Must finish first', 'Blockers' → 'Waiting on', 'Cycles' → 'Circular waiting (problem)'. Update all UI labels, tooltips, and AI prompts to use simplified language.

title: Polish UX to Apple quality
description:
Elevate the current functional MVP to Apple-quality UX:

- Motion design system (spring animations, gesture physics)
- Micro-interactions (haptic feedback, satisfying hover states)
- Typography refinement (perfect hierarchy, optical adjustments)
- Delightful empty states with illustrations
- Graceful error handling (no raw technical errors)
- Skeleton loading states
- Onboarding flow for new users
- Full accessibility (VoiceOver, keyboard nav, reduced motion)
- Mobile-first responsive (44pt touch targets)
- Graph improvements: force simulation, minimap, search, fit-to-view
- Sound design (optional subtle audio feedback)
- User testing and iteration

title: Visual drag preview for dependencies
description: When dragging to create dependency, show preview line. Visual feedback before committing.

title: Add inline help tooltips for unfamiliar concepts
description: Add hover tooltips that explain concepts in plain language: priority levels (P0-P4), status indicators (colored dots), what edges mean in graph view, what 'transitive' means. Use a consistent '?' icon or dotted underline to indicate help is available.

title: Build human issue tracker app with AI-powered relationships
description:
Create a web/macOS/iOS issue tracker for humans with:
- Apple-quality UX (must be tested and evaluated like code)
- Relationship management (dependencies, blocking) like bd
- AI-powered relationship detection that suggests relationships and only asks for confirmation when uncertain

Key requirements:
1. Choose easiest platform (likely web app)
2. UX testing integrated into quality gates
3. AI inference for relationship suggestions
close_reason: Implemented human issue tracker web app with SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS, localStorage persistence, and Claude API integration for AI-powered relationship suggestions

title: Make graph the default home view
description: Graph view should be the primary interface, not the list view. Users land on graph first.
close_reason: Graph is now the default view on main page with toggle to list view

title: Simplify AI model selection to presets
description: Current dropdown shows 20+ models which overwhelms non-technical users. Replace with 3 presets: 'Quick' (fast, cheaper), 'Balanced' (default), 'Thorough' (best quality). Hide full model list behind 'Advanced' toggle. Auto-select 'Balanced' for new users.

title: Add project templates for common life projects
description: Reduce blank-page anxiety with starter templates: 'Selling a House', 'Kitchen Remodel', 'College Application', 'Retirement Planning', 'Wedding Planning'. Each template pre-populates 5-10 common tasks with suggested dependencies. User can customize after creation. Templates sourced from AI or curated manually.

title: Add guided onboarding tutorial for first-time users
description: Create a 3-step interactive tutorial that introduces core concepts: (1) Create your first task, (2) Understand 'ready' vs 'waiting' with a visual example, (3) See AI suggest relationships. Should appear on first visit and be dismissable. Critical for non-experts who have never used project planning tools.

title: Simplify Dependency Manager to single-mode interface
description: Current 3-mode interface (overview/preview/manual) is overwhelming. Redesign as single view: show current dependencies with inline AI rebuild button, show proposed changes as inline diff, remove separate 'manual editing' mode in favor of inline add/remove buttons. Progressive disclosure: hide 'Advanced' options behind expandable section.

title: Add zero-config AI with optional API key
description: Current setup requires OPENROUTER_API_KEY which is significant friction for non-technical users. Options: (1) Provide a free tier with rate limits using a shared key, (2) Add clear step-by-step setup wizard with copy-paste links, (3) Make app functional without AI (degraded experience). Goal: user can start using AI features within 60 seconds of first visit.

title: Proactive AI suggestions on issue creation
description: When user creates an issue, AI automatically suggests related tasks and dependencies without user asking.

title: Add visual legend and help to graph view
description: Graph view is powerful but confusing for first-time users. Add: (1) Collapsible legend explaining node colors, edge direction, and size meaning, (2) 'Drag to rearrange' hint on first visit, (3) Complexity warning when 20+ nodes: 'Your plan is getting detailed - List view may be easier to scan'. Make legend dismissable after first view.

title: Quick-create flow with AI expansion
description: Type a few words, AI expands to full issue with title, description, type, priority. Minimal user input.
